emerging_technologies.name: Automated Software Development
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems capable of autonomously designing, coding, testing, and deploying software applications with minimal human oversight.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: This could lead to significant job displacement in programming roles, prompting a need for retraining programs and potentially reshaping the workforce dynamics.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High initial investment in AI infrastructure, need for trust and security protocols, ethical considerations regarding AI in critical systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Lace
emerging_technologies.description: A network of ultra-fine electrodes that can be woven into the brain, enhancing or restoring cognitive functions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises questions about privacy, identity, and the ethics of cognitive enhancement; could lead to a divide between enhanced and non-enhanced individuals.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Ethical concerns, regulatory hurdles, high development costs, and the need for public acceptance.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum Encryption
emerging_technologies.description: Utilizing quantum mechanics to create unbreakable encryption, ensuring secure data transmission.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could redefine privacy and security standards, potentially leading to new forms of digital espionage or the obsolescence of current encryption methods.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires significant advancements in quantum computing, international standards, and widespread infrastructure changes.

emerging_technologies.name: Sustainable Fusion Energy
emerging_technologies.description: Commercial fusion reactors providing near-infinite clean energy, solving many energy and climate issues.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could fundamentally change energy distribution, geopolitics, and lead to a shift in economic power structures.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technical challenges in achieving sustained fusion reactions, regulatory frameworks, and the need for global cooperation.

mainstream_technologies.name: Autonomous Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Vehicles capable of navigating without human intervention in most driving scenarios.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Already in pilot programs, expected to see widespread adoption by 2028, with regulatory frameworks and infrastructure adapting to support this technology.

mainstream_technologies.name: Blockchain Governance
mainstream_technologies.description: Decentralized governance systems for managing and validating transactions, contracts, and data integrity.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Growing acceptance in financial sectors, government services, and smart contracts; integration into various industries expected by 2027.

epoch_themes.description: A focus on technologies that automate processes and augment human capabilities.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for job displacement but also for new job creation in oversight and maintenance roles. The enhancement of human cognition could lead to societal stratification.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on AI ethics, workforce retraining, and public policy regarding human enhancement.

epoch_themes.description: Advancements in quantum technologies revolutionizing security protocols and encryption.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: A shift in cybersecurity paradigms, potentially rendering current encryption methods obsolete.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on quantum technology development, international cooperation for standards, and potential geopolitical shifts due to secure communication advancements.

epoch_themes.description: Development of technologies to address climate change and energy demands.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Could lead to energy independence, reduced carbon emissions, and a shift in global power dynamics.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push for sustainable energy sources, international collaboration in fusion research, and potential economic restructuring around energy.
